unichar constants
name type descrpition
UNICHAR_ENT_STRICT
int unistr_decode_entity(): Warns and returns false when undefined entity or invalid code is found.
UNICHAR_ENT_ALLOW_CTRL
int unistr_decode_entity(): Allows all control characters (0x00-0x1F, 0x7F-0x9F).
UNICHAR_ENT_CTRL_TO_SPACE
int unistr_decode_entity(): Replaces all control characters (0x00-0x1F, 0x7F-0x9F) with SPACE(0x20).
UNICHAR_ENT_NBSP_TO_SPACE
int unistr_decode_entity(): Replaces NBSP(non-breaking space, 0xA0) with SPACE(0x20).
UNICHAR_ENT_IGNORE_NUL
int unistr_decode_entity(): Ignores the numeric entity which refers to NUL(0x00). (the default flag)
UNICHAR_ENT_IGNORE_CTRL
int unistr_decode_entity(): Ignores the numeric entity which refers to control character (0x00-0x1F, 0x7F-0x9F).
UNICHAR_ENT_REMOVE_NUL
int unistr_decode_entity(): Remvoes the numeric entity which refers to NUL(0x00).
UNICHAR_ENT_REMOVE_CTRL
int unistr_decode_entity(): Remvoes the numeric entity which refers to control character (0x00-0x1F, 0x7F-0x9F).
UNICHAR_ENT_WARN_NUL
int unistr_decode_entity(): Warns and returns false when the numeric entity which refers to NUL(0x00) is found.
UNICHAR_ENT_WARN_CTRL
int unistr_decode_entity(): Warns and returns false when the numeric entity which refers to control character (0x00-0x1F, 0x7F-0x9F) is found.
